item.title: Rubbish bag and wood dog poo in bag, 2nd October
item.description:
Bag full of rubbish, pieces of wood dog poo bag and lots of tissues at base of tree. It was bin collection day today. Why couldnâ€™t the bin collectors take all the rubbish they see lying around? The base of tree is overgrown and covered in rubbish. Thankyou

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Building materials left in road outside nos. 4/6 Eversley Road, 2nd October
item.description:

item.title: Unswept roads and footpaths. Blocked drains, 2nd October
item.description:
The area of Rydal Drive and the Green Bexleyheath drastically needs a clearance of dropped leaves and Crab Apples that are covering the roadway and footpaths making it dangerous for pedestrians. Drains are also blocked by leaves making flooding inevitable. The area has not been cleaned for months. Please attend asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 181, The Green, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Church Lane end of Floyd Road, 2nd October
item.description:
More black bags and overflowing palladin bins. This situation has been going on for MONTHS. Pse do not tell me that this will be dealt with at the next scheduled sweep (it never is) or that I can become an Environmental Champion. It needs Enforcement action and/or referral to HSE to deal with this permanent violation of hygiene and refuse disposal rules. I guess a bot is dealing with this as not even Fix My Street complaints by a Greenwich councillor ( D L Gardner) get any action. THIS IS A DISGRACE.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Charlton Church Lane, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No access to home, 2nd October
item.description:
Workmen have turned up with no notice and dug up the from of our houses with no safe passes to access our homes or leave them. Workmen just laugh at me when I try speak to them very rude. Unable to Leave my home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rangefield Road, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
